# Start Building

## How to create and include Web5 App instance in your app:

There’s only one class needed for all operations, it creates an isolated API object for doing all Web5 things.

Open your <code>index.js</code> file and add this right below your Web5 import:

<pre>const web5 = new Web5()</pre>

## Objects within Web5:
Web5 is split into three main top-level objects:
- web5.dwn
- web5.did
- web5.vc

Let’s first focus on the `web5.did` namespace to continue building our app

## Step One, Create DID, `web5.did`:

:::info
A [Decentralized Identifier (DID)](https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/),
is an W3C specification for an address representing who you are on the decentralized web. You 
can [learn more about them here](/docs/web5/learn/decentralized-identifiers) as 
a core concept behind Web5.
:::

For some context, in the world of Web5, a user’s unique identifier, like an email address, is called a DID. This is a decentralized app so we need an identifier that isn’t tied to a centralized authority. It can be used to identify and associate a user’s data across any platform.

Let’s create a DID using the Web5 API with the <code>ion</code> method name:

Right below your new Web5 instance paste:
<pre>let did = await web5.did.create('ion');</pre>

*We’re using ION here as the method name, learn more about other method names [here](https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#methods).*

Now let's run `index.js` and see what it would return:

In index.js paste:
<pre>console.log(did.id)</pre>

In terminal and run:
<pre>node src/index.js</pre>

Output should look something like:
```js
did:ion:EiBSuKWKAC0zpoM3KlhoyZxCHaMN5TBbcr-C18VRNZGYUQ:
```

### Play around without opening terminal, click `Run!` to create a DID in the browser, `web5.did.create`:
